properties.name: Cattail Falls, Big Bend NP
properties.description: Posted by ChupacervezaNo swimming allowed. This is the drinking water source for the Chisos Basin. Unpublished trail because people pollute the water. Trail is open to non-polluters. Which are you? Recommend two liters of water per person and a snack for the grotto. Slow moving families of tarantulas can be observed in the mornings.

properties.name: Chisos (Basin) Mountains Lodge and Restaurant, Big Bend NP
properties.description: Posted by ChupacervezaÂ CCC lodge and restaurant managed by contract vendor.

properties.name: Chisos Basin Campground, Big Bend NP
properties.description: Posted by ChupacervezaOpen All Year 63 campsites. Flush toilets, running water, grills, and picnic tables are available. NO HOOK-UPS. 0 per night( per night for bearers of the Golden Age or Golden Access Passport). Elevation 5,400\'. Due to the narrow, winding road to the Basin, and small campsites, trailers over 20\' and RV\'s over 24\' are not recommended at this campground. RESERVABLE CAMPSITES: Reservations available for 26 sites November 15 to April 15. Contact www.reserveusa.com or call 1-877-444-6777. Big Bend National Park cannot make reservations. GROUP CAMPING: The Chisos Basin Campground has six group camp sites that are available only by advance reservation. The total overnight occupancy for the Chisos Basin group campground is 118 persons. All sites in this campground have a minimum occupancy of 10 persons. Sites L, P, Q, and R hold a maximum of 20 persons each. Sites N and O hold a maximum occupancy of 14 persons each. Site M has a maximum occupancy of 10 persons. Tents larger than 8\' X 8\' are not recommended because of site layout; however, sites P, Q, and R can accommodate larger tents if necessary. Sites P, Q, and R have shade ramadas. To reserve the group campsite, contact www.reserveusa.com or call 1-877-444-6777. Big Bend National Park cannot make reservations.

properties.name: Chisos Basin Store, Big Bend NP
properties.description: Posted by ChupacervezaOpen All Year Chisos Basin Store: 432.477.2291 Basic camping supplies and groceries are available. This "place" is actually one building to the west. I\'ll fix it when fixing becomes doable.

properties.name: Chisos Basin Visitor Center, Big Bend NP
properties.description: Posted by ChupacervezaOpen All Year November to March 8am - 3:30pm April to November 9am - 4:30pm The Chisos Basin Visitor Center is located in the Basin developed area, adjacent to the parking lot. The Chisos Mountains trailhead is 100 yards to the west of the Visitor Center. Visitor Center exhibits on the Peregrine Falcon, Black Bear, and Mountain Lion provide more information on these species\' lives in the Chisos Mountains. Available Facilities Big Bend Natural History Association bookstore and restrooms. Backcountry camping permits can be issued from the Visitor Center during normal hours. A water faucet is available for filling personal water containers.

properties.name: Hot Springs parking lot, Big Bend NP
properties.description: Posted by ChupacervezaThe hot springs are always open. No glass containers are allowed. Very nice, especially after dark. Good to get bearings while the sun is up though. A bather can reach their arm out of the sitting pool into the passing Rio Grande. Requires short walk on soft sand. Not strenuous except for narrow-wheeled conveyances.

properties.name: Panther Junction Service Station, Big Bend NP
properties.description: Posted by ChupacervezaOpen All Year Panther Junction Service Station: 432.477.2294 Available Facilities Gasoline is available at two locations in the park operated by Forever Resorts Inc. The Panther Junction station offers gas, diesel, and can undertake minor repairs. The gas station at Rio Grande Village is located in the store, and also provides propane.

properties.name: Panther Junction Visitor Center, Big Bend NP
properties.description: Posted by ChupacervezaOpen All Year 8:00 - 6:00 (432) 477-2251 The Panther Junction Visitor Center is located at Panther Junction. Exhibits provide an overview to the complex geology, natural and cultural histories that are present at Big Bend. The Panther Path, a self-guided nature trail begins adjacent to the porch of the visitor center. Available Facilities Backcountry camping and river use permits can be issued from the Visitor Center during normal hours. Big Bend Natural History Association Bookstore, U.S. Post Office, Public Phone, and Restrooms. A water faucet is available for filling personal water containers.

properties.name: Parking for Upper and Lower Windows Trails and Cattail Falls Trail, Big Bend NP
properties.description: Posted by ChupacervezaNo POVs beyond this point. Park and walk from here.

properties.name: Rio Grande Village Visitor Center, Big Bend NP
properties.description: Posted by ChupacervezaNovember through April 8:30 a.m. - 4:00 p.m. May through October Closed The Visitor Center is located a quarter-mile to the north of the Rio Grande Village developed area. The Rio Grande Village Visitor Center is open seasonally (November through April). Learn more about animal life along the Rio Grande; exhibits explore bats and other animals that call the Big Bend home. Find out more about the endangered Big Bend Gambusia, a fish found only in the park. In front of the Visitor Center a small desert garden provides an excellent overview of the plants of the Chihuahuan Desert. A mini-theater is also available for viewing Big Bend videos. Available Facilities Public Showers (pay with quarters) usually similar to or longer hours than Gas Station. Call for shower times. Big Bend Natural History Association bookstore, public phone and restrooms. A water faucet is available for filling personal water containers. Backcountry and river use permits can be issued from the Visitor Center during normal hours. During the 2004/2005 winter season entrance fees can be paid at the Rio Grande Village Visitor Center.

properties.name: The Window, Big Bend NP
properties.description: Posted by Chupacerveza5.2 miles from Chisos Basin Trailhead About 4 miles if you hike from the Basin campground. Climbs 800 ft. on return. The window is a natural waterfall that opens to a spectacular vista looking west towards Terlingua.

properties.name: Trail Junction, Upper and Lower Windows Falls and Cattail Falls, Big Bend NP
properties.description: Posted by ChupacervezaThis is the trail junction separating the upper and lower Windows Falls trails from the Cattail Falls trail. It is on the water tank service road by the creek and shaded by the large trees here.

properties.name: Window Overlook, Big Bend NP
properties.description: Posted by ChupacervezaFrom this location one can hike either out of or into the Chisos Basin and can look down upon people on the Window trail. This trail can be treacherous due to loose rock and high wind and is not suitable for vertigo sufferers. Accessible from inside the Basin at Oak Creek junction from Window trail. Accessible from outside the Basin via parking lot on unimproved access road that is across Ross Maxwell Scenic Drive from Sam Nail Ranch. Bring two liters of water per person.
